conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D isometric/cutaway model: walls have height and thickness, multiple faces are visible, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion with readable corners and volumes; isometric view is correct and the cutaway is clean. Minor simplification of architectural detailing and openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall apartment footprint and a central living space are suggested, and three bedrooms are present, but the 2D plan’s key program/layout is not faithfully reproduced: multiple toilets/baths, utility, and balcony placements do not match; internal partitions and circulation (wide passages) are heavily altered/simplified.

interior_elements.notes: Beds and living/dining furniture are present; basic kitchen counters/appliances implied. Bathroom fixtures are largely missing/unclear versus the 2D plan’s multiple toilets.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with good readability of walls/floors and minimal artifacts. Openings are visible but not detailed enough to verify against the plan.

detected_errors.description: Several major plan spaces are missing or not represented correctly (multiple toilets/baths, utility area, and balcony configuration compared to the 2D plan).
Internal wall/partition layout and circulation relationships (passages, adjacency of wet areas to bedrooms/kitchen) are significantly distorted from the 2D drawing.
Door/window placement and quantity cannot be matched to the 2D plan; openings appear simplified and likely on incorrect walls.
Furniture is generic and does not help reliably identify all rooms (notably bathrooms), reducing room-identity fidelity.

summary: A valid 3D cutaway was produced, but the generated model significantly deviates from the 2D plan’s room program and partition geometry (especially wet areas, utility, and balconies).
